SourcedStatement: A Southwest spokesperson told The Oaklandside that the assertion that any Oakland employee was forced to work while sick or take unpaid absences is unfounded.
Name: Southwest Airlines

SourcedStatement: “Southwest Airlines fully complies with applicable sick leave laws in Oakland and California, as well as with the terms of a December 2020 settlement agreement with the city,” the spokesperson said in a statement.
Name: Southwest Airlines

SourcedStatement: In a press release, the city attorney said Southwest’s practices were especially detrimental during the COVID-19 pandemic, when workers were forced to report to work even when they were sick.
Name: City of Oakland

SourcedStatement: Some of the newer complaints from Southwest workers were filed with Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards, which enforces wage and hour laws in the city.
Name: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Justification: enforces wage and hour laws in the city

SourcedStatement: “The City of Oakland is committed to protecting workers by ensuring that all employers in Oakland are complying with laws that protect their rights,” Parker said in a statement.
Name: Barbara Parker
Title: City Attorney
Justification: City Attorney Barbara Parker filed a lawsuit in Alameda County Superior Court

SourcedStatement: “We are grateful that the City of Oakland is holding Southwest accountable. We hope that Southwest policies and practices will finally change for good,” Eric Swygert, a Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555, said in a statement.
Name: Eric Swygert
Title: Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555
Justification: a Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555

SourcedStatement: According to the complaint, Southwest has been denying some of its workers in Oakland the right to use earned paid sick leave.
Name: Alameda County Superior Court
Justification: the complaint filed in Alameda County Superior Court

SourcedStatement: In December 2020, the city and Southwest signed a settlement in which, among other things, the airline agreed to fully restore the sick leave hours it had canceled for certain workers between 2017 and 2020.
Name: City of Oakland and Southwest Airlines

SourcedStatement: Oakland has several laws that protect workers, including Measure FF, a 2014 ordinance approved by Oakland voters that established a minimum wage and requires employers to provide paid sick leave to employees.
Name: City of Oakland
Justification: Measure FF, a 2014 ordinance approved by Oakland voters

SourcedStatement: Last year, this relatively new department ordered a Radisson Hotel in East Oakland to pay $404,491 to workers who were allegedly underpaid for nearly a year.
Name: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Justification: the order from Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
